education.gpa: Became the first undergraduate student to lead a software PoC on behalf of the Viterbi School of Engineering Board of Directors (project iPodia)
Awarded Student-Athlete Scholarship (Fall, Spring) for maintaining 3.5 GPA while competing with Water Polo team

highlights: Guided Clients through a design thinking sessions to create persona profiles, identifying pain points, and storyboard
Delivered PoC hybrid mobile application with API callbacks, user graph creation (ChartJS), and Bluetooth enabled device
Collaborated with engineering team to enable bluetooth connection with third party medical devices with PoC mobile application
Led push for better DevOps architecture pipeline for internal website using Docker (Docker-Compose) with Jenkins
Proposed and led the development of a POC chrome extension and router prototype for Ph.D. Andreas Molisch
Recruited, hired, and managed a team of 4: 1 software engineer, 2 Android developers, and 1 designer
Implemented agile development acting as both scrum master and product owner reducing development time by 25%
Publish undergraduate thesis on caching alternatives and the data mining of video streaming user behavior (https://goo.gl/bftNQR)
Proposed and developed a P2P platform using multiple APIâ€™s integrations and Slack Messaging application
Increased classroom participation from 500 monthly messages to 20,000 monthly messages with PoC
Initiated agile development with weekly testing reducing anticipated development time by 25%
Characterized antenna patterns by SNR, efficiency, power, in 2D and 3D polar plots reducing analysis time by 65%
Published in-house MatLab RF Analysis tool - saving estimated costs of $1500 per license for DARPA's TBG program
